scenario: Illinois Tool Works (ITW) reported Q1 earnings of $2.44 per share on $3.8 billion in sales, beating the $2.35 per share consensus estimate but falling short on revenue by $40 million. Sales declined 3.4% year-over-year due to foreign currency fluctuations and weak demand in some end markets. The company maintained its full-year guidance, expecting price increases and other actions to offset tariff cost impacts. ITW's operating margin was 24.8% in Q1, down from 26.8% in full-year 2024. The stock price declined 4% as of 10:30 a.m. ET on Wednesday. Despite the challenging environment, ITW is a strong company with a nearly 3% dividend yield, making it a potential long-term investment opportunity for patient investors.
